results.title: The Chain Reaction
results.creator_credit: Ian Barry, Ross Matthews and Palm Beach Pictures
results.brief_description: A thriller in which a married couple are thrown into a world of terror, after being contaminated with radioactivity. Cast includes Steve Bisley, Hugh Keays-Byrne, Lorna Lesley. Photography by Nixon Binney.

results.title: Cathy's Child
results.creator_credit: Donald Crombie, Errol Sullivan and Pam Oliver
results.brief_description: In 1973, Cathy Baikas, a Maltese immigrant, contacted “The Sun” newspaper office in Sydney to seek help. Cathy’s Greek-born husband, from whom she was separated, had left for Greece, taking with him their baby daughter. The incident becomes a “cause celebre” and eventually Cathy is given custody of her daughter, and a passport to travel to Greece. With the help of the Australian Consul in Athens she manages to get her daughter back from her husband’s family. Based on “Sun” journalist, Dick Wardley’s book, “A Piece of Paper”. Cast includes Michelle Fawdon, Bryan Brown and Frankie J. Holden.

results.title: Rambo: first blood. Part II (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: George Pan Cosmatos, Buzz Feitshans and Tri-Star Pictures
results.brief_description: He’s on a mission and that’s just where he belongs! He’s told not to engage the enemy. “Just take pictures”, they say. But telling Rambo to hold back is like ordering a rattle-snake not to bite. Rambo’s dropped into the Vietnam jungle to find out if there are still any POW’s about. There are. And now Rambo’s going to get them home - on his own! Caption version only available. Rated: M

results.title: Great expectations
results.creator_credit: David Lean, Anthony Havelock-Allan, Cineguild and Independent Producers
results.brief_description: Widely lauded as the best cinematic translation ever achieved of Dickens’ work and one of the greatest British films of all time, ‘Great Expectations’ follows the life of orphan Pip Pirrip from his humble beginnings as a blacksmith’s apprentice in the 1830s to his days as the wealthy beneficiary of an escaped convict he once helped. Despite the inevitable simplifications of the novel Lean fully realises its cinematic potential, capturing the spirit of Dickens and translating his prose into flawless cinema. Cinematographer Guy Green and production designer John Bryan won Academy Awards for their impressive work. Stars John Mills, Valerie Hobson, Finlay Currie, Alec Guinness, Bernard Miles, Francis Sullivan and Jean Simmonds.

results.title: A Man for all seasons
results.brief_description: Robert Bolt’s literate and penetrating treatment of the conflict waged between Sir Thomas More and King Henry VIII makes a smooth transition to the screen. Zinnemann has mounted a film with an eye for characterisation rather than spectacle and the result is a superior drama. Stars Paul Scofield, Robert Shaw, Wendy Hiller, Orson Welles, Susannah York and Vanessa Redgrave. Rated: G

results.title: [Maya Deren Compilation]
results.brief_description: A collection of films of Maya Deren. 1. “Private Life of a Cat” An animal’s outlook on life, narrated by Maya Deren, but directed by Alexander Hammid; 2. “Study in Choreography” A dancer moves across a land scape; 3. “Very Eye of Night” Dancers performing in negative; 4. “Meditation on Violence” A young Oriental man performs shadowboxing; 5. “Ritual in Transfigured Time” Movements of the dancers are merged with a variety of photographic effects.

results.title: West Side Story
results.creator_credit: Jerome Robbins, Robert Wise, Mirisch Corporation and Seven Arts Productions
results.brief_description: America, “Tonight”, “Maria”, “Somewhere”, “I Feel Pretty” - just some of the sensational evergreen songs from “West Side Story”, the winner of ten Oscars including Best Picture. Opening with the now famous helicopter shot of Manhattan, “West Side Story” is the heart-rending, brilliantly tuneful contemporary version of “Romeo and Juliet”. The gang rivalry between The Jets and the Puerto Rican Sharks reaches fever pitch when ex-Jet Tony falls in love with Maria, the sister of Shark leader Bernardo. When Bernado is killed in a gang misunderstanding, Tony and Maria become the unwilling, tragic participants in the resulting vendetta. Music by Leonard Bernstein. Starring Natalie Wood as Maria, Richard Beymer as Tony, Russ Tamblyn as Riff and Rita Moreno as Anita. Based on the book by Arthur Laurents.

results.title: Who's Afraid of Virginia Woolf?
results.creator_credit: Mike Nichols, Ernest Lehman and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Nichol’s debut feature after a string of successes on Broadway retained the taboo-breaking profane and sexually charged dialogue of Albee’s stage play, the likes of which had not previously been heard in a big studio film. Burton and Taylor play a married couple in decline who engage in a relentless, vitriolic war of words over the course of one night in the presence of their guests. The film was rehearsed for three weeks before shooting started and was both a critical and box-office success, winning five Oscars. Cast: Elizabeth Taylor, Richard Burton, Sandy Dennis, George Segal.

results.title: The Diary of Anne Frank
results.creator_credit: George Stevens and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A faithful screen translation of the Broadway play, based on the book, about the harrowing experiences of the Jewish Frank family and their friends when they are forced to hide from the Nazis in an Amsterdam factory for two years. Millie Perkins is visually perfect as the young Anne Frank whose spirit gives the group courage to continue when they lose hope.

results.title: Rebel without a cause
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Ray, David Weisbart and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: A sensitively acted story of a teenager who is not satisfied with a world he never made. James Dean’s performance is touching and exciting with an extraordinary supporting cast in Natalie Wood, Sal Mineo, Jim Backus, Ann Doran, Dennis Hopper and Nick Adams. Rated: M
